column5: i decided to take my son daniel to a fish lift today. we have never been to one before and wanted to see what it is that they do there.  this is the milne dam where they get the fish from   setting up the scale   the cage where the fish are brought up from the lake   the first rainbow   first they get weighed - andy with the red jacket over see's the operation, jermey in the back ground is showing daniel what to do and daniel is handling all the fish.   after the weighing they go over to measured, eggs carefully removed,an electronic chip put into the fish and then one fin clipped     then back into the lake they go, alive
thats cool. But why remove eggs and why clip one fin? sorry for silly questions....
my guess is for stocking programs, and to identify fish that they've implanted etc to monitor where/when they're caught and all of that.  ryan
yes dunner you are correct. i also posted the why's in another post RING WOOD HATCHERY we went there right after the fish lift
Nice report Dann - looks like Daniel is a natural at that. Wish I could have been there.   Don
you can !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! we are going again this friday........
Just might take you up on that.  Don
